byline.original: By SEAN D. NAYLOR and CHRISTOPHER DREW

abstract: Air Force formally recommends late Sgt John Chapman for Medal of Honor after examination of aerial video reveals Chapman fought on after SEAL Team 6 left him for dead on Afghan mountain top in 2002; revelation reopens old wounds for SEAL Team 6, which had already been accused of bungling mission; medal, if awarded, would be first ever to be given based not on eyewitness account but on technological evidence.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: An airman with the unit is being considered for the Medal of Honor after new video analysis suggested that he fought alone bravely in a 2002 battle on an Afghan peak.
snippet: An airman with the unit is being considered for the Medal of Honor after new video analysis suggested that he fought alone bravely in a 2002 battle on an Afghan peak....

headline.main: SEAL Team 6 and a Man Left for Dead: A Grainy Picture of Valor
headline.print_headline: An Airman Left for Dead, but Signs He Fought On
